Welcome to AddressBook’s documentation!¶

AddressBook Main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks the health of the database. It does this by executing a SQL query and checking if it returns any results. If it doesn’t, then we know something is wrong with our database connection.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession: Inject the database session into the function

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.root(request: Request)¶

The root function is the entry point for the web application. It returns a TemplateResponse object, which contains an HTML template and data to be rendered by Jinja2. The template file is located in templates/index.html.

Parameters:

request – Request: Pass the request object into the function

Returns:

A templateresponse object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are needed by your app, like database connections or external APIs.

Returns:

A dictionary with a key called &quot;app&quot;

Doc-author:

Trelent

AddressBook database Config¶

classmethod validate_algorithm(v)¶

The validate_algorithm function is a helper function that validates the algorithm used to sign the JWT. The validate_algorithm function takes in one argument, cls, which is an instance of the Auth0 class. The validate_algorithm function also takes in another argument, v, which represents a string value for the algorithm used to sign the JWT.

Parameters:

  • cls – Pass the class object to the function

  • v – Pass the value of the algorithm that is being validated

Returns:

The value of the argument v

Doc-author:

Trelent

AddressBook database Db¶

class src.database.db.DataBaseSessionManager(url: str)¶

Bases: object

session()¶

The session function is a coroutine that returns an async context manager. The context manager yields a database session, and then closes the session when the block exits. The close method rolls back any uncommitted changes to the database.

Parameters:

self – Represent the instance of the class

Returns:

A context manager, which is a generator that can be used with the async with statement

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.database.db.get_db()¶

The get_db function is a coroutine that returns an async context manager. When the context manager is entered, it yields a database session; when the context manager exits, it closes the session. The get_db function itself can be used as an async context manager:

Returns:

A context manager that allows you to use async with

Doc-author:

Trelent

AddressBook middlewares Ip_middleware¶

async src.middlewares.ip_middleware.ban_ips(request: Request, call_next: Callable)¶

The ban_ips function is a middleware function that checks if the client’s IP address is in the BANNED_IPS list. If it is, then we return a JSONResponse with status code 403 and a detail message explaining why they are banned. Otherwise, we call next(request) to pass the request on to the next middleware function or route handler.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Access the request object

  • call_next – Callable: Pass the next function in the chain to be called

Returns:

A jsonresponse object if the ip address is banned

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.middlewares.ip_middleware.limit_access_by_ip(request: Request, call_next: Callable)¶

The limit_access_by_ip function is a middleware function that limits access to the API by IP address. It checks if the client’s IP address is in ALLOWED_IPS, and if not, returns a 403 Forbidden response.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Get the client’s ip address

  • call_next – Callable: Pass the next function in the pipeline

Returns:

A jsonresponse object with a 403 status code and an error message

Doc-author:

Trelent

AddressBook middlewares User_agent_middleware¶

async src.middlewares.user_agent_middleware.user_agent_ban_middleware(request: Request, call_next: Callable)¶

The user_agent_ban_middleware function is a middleware function that checks the user-agent header of an incoming request. If the user-agent matches any of the patterns in our ban list, then we return a 403 Forbidden response with a detail message. Otherwise, we call next and return whatever response comes back from that.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Access the request object

  • call_next – Callable: Call the next middleware in the chain

Returns:

A jsonresponse object with a status code of 403 and a content of {&quot;detail&quot;: &quot;you are banned&quot;}

Doc-author:

Trelent

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Ensure that the user is only deleting their own contacts

The contact that was deleted

async src.repository.contacts.get_all_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession)¶
The get_all_contacts function returns a list of all contacts in the database.

The limit and offset parameters are used to paginate the results.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of rows to skip before starting to return rows

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of all contacts in the database

Doc-author:

Trelent

The get_birthday_contacts function returns a list of contacts whose birthday is within the next X days.

Parameters:

  • days – int: Determine how many days in the future to look for birthdays

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶
The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the current user.

The limit and offset parameters are used to paginate the results.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • offset – int: Skip the first n rows of the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • current_user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(search: str, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶
The search_contacts function searches for contacts in the database.

It takes a search string and returns all contacts that match the search criteria.

Parameters:

  • search – str: Filter the contacts by name, lastname or email

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Filter the results by the user that is currently logged in

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

  • body – ContactUpdateSchema: Validate the data sent in the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Access the database

  • current_user – User: Check if the user is authenticated

Returns:

A contact object, which is the same as what we get from the create_contact function

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and returns the user associated with that email.

If no user is found, it will return None.

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

A user object, which is the result of a database query

AddressBook routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. Then, it checks if that user exists in our database, and if they do not exist, we raise an HTTPException with a status code of 400 (Bad Request) and detail message &quot;Verification error&quot;.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A message to the user that their email has been confirmed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with an access token, a refresh token and the type of token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Depends(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns a new access_token, refresh_token, and the type of bearer.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the refresh token from the request header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

:param : Get the user’s email from the token :return: A new access_token and refresh_token :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will allow them to confirm their email address. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already a confirmed user with that email address, and if so returns an error message saying as much. If not, it sends an asynchronous task (using FastAPI’s BackgroundTasks) to send_email(), passing in the user’s email, username and base url.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the body of the request

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

:param : Send the email to the user :return: A message to the user :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.auth.reset_password(new_password: str, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The reset_password function is used to reset a user’s password.

Parameters:

  • new_password – str: Get the new password from the request body

  • bt – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the request

  • user – User: Get the current user

  • db – AsyncSession: Get a database session

:param : Get the current user :return: The user object :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • bt – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

:param : Get the user’s email :return: A userschema object :doc-author: Trelent

AddressBook routes Check_open¶

async src.routes.check_open.check_open_f(username: str, response: Response, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The check_open_f function is a function that checks if the user has opened the email.

It takes in three parameters: username, response and db. The username parameter is used to identify which user we are checking for, while the response parameter is used to return an image file that will be displayed on screen when this endpoint gets called by our frontend application. The db parameter allows us to access our database.

Parameters:

  • username – str: Get the username from the url

  • response – Response: Return a response to the user

  • db – AsyncSession: Get a database connection from the dependency

Returns:

A png image

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_all_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_all_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • ge – Specify the minimum value of the parameter

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Skip the first n records

  • ge – Specify a lower limit for the value of the parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database connection

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

:param : Limit the number of contacts returned :return: A list of contacts :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_birthday_contacts(days: int = Query(7), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_birthday_contacts function returns a list of contacts that have birthdays within the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • days – int: Specify how many days in the future to look for birthdays

  • ge – Specify that the value of days must be greater than or equal to 1

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

:param : Specify the number of days to look ahead for birthdays :return: A list of contact objects :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

:param : Get the contact id from the url :return: A contact object :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • ge – Set a minimum value for the limit parameter

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned to 500

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • ge – Set a minimum value for the limit and offset parameters

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

:param : Get the contact by id :return: A list of contacts :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdateSchema, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

It takes an id, body and db as arguments. The body is validated using ContactUpdateSchema and then passed to repository_contact’s update_contact function along with the id, db and current user.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactUpdateSchema: Validate the request body

  • contact_id – int: Get the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Get a database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

:param : Get the contact id from the url :return: A contact object :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_status_contact(body: ContactStatusUpdate, contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The update_status_contact function updates the status of a contact.

  • contact_id – int: Find the contact in the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user information

:param : Get the contact id :return: A contact object :doc-author: Trelent

AddressBook routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.get_current_user(user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used by the

get_current_active_user function. It uses the auth service to retrieve information about the current user, and returns it as a User object.

Parameters:

user – User: Pass the user object to the function

Returns:

The user object of the currently logged in user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.update_avatar(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Updates the avatar of a user.

This function takes in three parameters: - file (UploadFile): The file to update the avatar with, obtained from the request. - user (User): The current user obtained from the database. - db (AsyncSession): The database session.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: The file to update the avatar with.

  • user – User: The current user obtained from the database.

  • db – AsyncSession: The database session.

Returns:

The updated user.

Doc-author:

Trelent

AddressBook services Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = '123213213123fgedgfdg'¶
cache = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a JWT token with the following claims:

  • iat: Issued At Time, when the token was created.

  • exp: Expiration Time, when the token will expire.

  • scope: The scope of this access_token (e.g., &quot;access_token&quot;).

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes and methods

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded in the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

A jwt token that contains the data passed to it

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes in a dictionary of data and returns a token. The function first creates an encoded copy of the data dictionary, then adds two keys to it: iat (issued at) and exp (expiration). It then uses the jwt library to encode this new dictionary with our SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM. Finally, it returns this encoded token.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the attributes and methods of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the token

Returns:

A token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The time in seconds until the refresh token expires. Defaults to None, which is 7 days from creation date.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the user’s id, username and email

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

A refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It will raise an exception if the token is invalid or has expired.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user if it’s valid, otherwise raises an HTTPException with status code 401.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes and methods

  • token – str: Pass the token from the authorization header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. It does this by decoding the JWT using our secret key and algorithm, then returning the subject (sub) field of the payload.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token as a string to the function

Returns:

The email address from the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as an argument and returns the hashed version of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object’s hash method, which uses bcrypt to generate a secure hash.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass in the password that is to be hashed

Returns:

A hash of the password

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and a hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed password.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the user class

  • plain_password – Pass in the password that is being verified

  • hashed_password – Compare the hashed password in the database to a plain text password that is entered by a user

Returns:

True if the password is correct, and false otherwise

Doc-author:

Trelent

AddressBook services Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.

This function takes in three parameters: - email (EmailStr): The user’s email address, which is used as a unique identifier for each account. - username (str): The username of the account that was just created. This is included in case there are multiple accounts associated with one email address. - host (str): The hostname of the server.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: The email address of the user.

  • username – str: The username to include in the email template.

  • host – str: The hostname of the server.

Returns:

A coroutine object.

Raises:

ConnectionErrors: If there’s an error connecting to the email server.

Author:

Trelent
